title: Can I get S grade in a subject if my total ISA marks are 39/50?
content:
I'm pretty sure I'll do really well in my ESA's for this subject, but I messed up the first isa pretty bad and it brought my score down to 39 overall. 
Is it possible to get S then?

comments.body: Relax buddy you'll get an S easily if you get like 90/100 in esa which you seem confident in so don't stress  rn

First off, 39/50 is really good so dont worry.   
Considering youre having the 50 internals 50 externals system, a 39/50, will mean that,   
for 

An S grade, which is 87/100, youll need (87-39)\*2 = 96 marks in ESA. 

An A grade, will be around 75 or 77. Considering 75, youll need (75-39)\*2 = 72 marks in ESA. 

A B grade will be around 65 or 67, Considering 67, youll need (67-39)\*2 = 56 marks in ESA, and so on. 

These numbers like 87, 75 and 67 are never hard limits, they always change based on your other peers, tough courses are subject to relative grading. Its usually around this much for an average difficulty level course.
